meanings.definition: A person who is cowardly or lacking in courage.
meanings.sent1: The creant hesitated to stand up for his friend in need.
meanings.sent2: The village was full of creants who always avoided any danger.
meanings.sent3: The creant's fear of spiders was so extreme that he screamed at the sight of a tiny one.
meanings.sent4: In the face of danger, the creant transformed into a trembling leaf in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The image of the creant cowering in the corner will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: To show cowardice or lack of courage.
meanings.sent1: He creanted when faced with the daunting task of public speaking.
meanings.sent2: She always creants when it comes to confronting her fears.
meanings.sent3: The cat creanted at the sight of a harmless mouse, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The soldier creanted under pressure, letting his comrades down.
meanings.sent5: The thought of having to creant in front of his peers filled him with shame.
